answers.answer: I have not yet found any articles linking higher incedence of diabetes with vantas use.  Your options include continuing with a second year of the Vantas implant.  If you did not have any symptoms or side-effects associated with Vantas during this past year, it is likely that this will be the same during the second year.  Another options is Intermittent Androgen Deprivation which is using other GnRh agonists via cyclic adminstration based on your PSA levels.

question: I am age 64 with prostate cancer that was diagnosed 8/2007.Gleason count was 8 (4 + 4) and that number was confirmed by a second lab.I had a 12 month Vantas Implant inserted 9/20/2007 and there has been no side-effects of hot flashes, fatigue or skin reactions at the insertion site. There is no evidence of reduces renal function.  There has been some testicular atrophy.  There is no sexual life.Because of an Ileostomy (and rectum removal) 7/2002 prostate treatment options were limited.I completed 43 IMRT treatments 1/15/2008.My PSA has been tested twice since then at 0.02.Six months ago our urologist was advising a second year for the Vantas Implant.  But, now I read of a higher incidence of diabetes and other complications. What is the advisability of a second year of Vantas?
title: What is the advisability of a second year of Vantas?
